meanings.sent1: She checked the locks neurotically before leaving the house.
meanings.sent2: He always taps his foot neurotically when he's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The cat neurotically chased its tail in circles, amusing everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The old clock ticked neurotically, as if it was anxious about the time passing.
meanings.sent5: The student chewed on the end of their pencil neurotically during the exam.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of or affected by neurosis
meanings.sent1: Her neurotically organized desk was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: The neurotically clean person couldn't stand a speck of dust in their home.
meanings.sent3: The neurotically precise chef insisted on measuring every ingredient to the exact gram.
meanings.sent4: The neurotically cautious driver double-checked every mirror before changing lanes.
meanings.sent5: The neurotically anxious dog barked at every little noise outside.
